front.title: IANA Allocation Guidelines for the IPv6 Routing Header

abstract.t: This document specifies the IANA guidelines for allocating new values for the Routing Type field in the IPv6 Routing Header.

section.title: Introduction
section.t: This document specifies the IANA guidelines for allocating new values for the Routing Type field in the IPv6 Routing Header . Previously, no IANA guidance existed for such allocations.

section.title: IANA Considerations
section.t: New Routing Type values are allocated through IETF Review or IESG Approval .
Note that two experimental values (253 and 254) are already available for use .

section.title: Security Considerations
section.t: This specification does not change the security properties of the Routing Header. However, past experience shows that it is easy to design routing headers that have significant problems .

section.title: Changes from RFC 2460
section.t: This document specifies only the IANA rules associated with the Routing Type field.
